textAfterTable: 8 Songs Biography Born: 07 January 1899 in Lourenco Marques, Mozambique Genre: Vocal Years Active: '30s The most popular vocalist in Britain during the 1930s, Al Bowlly showcased a range of material unsurpassed by any contemporary other than Bing Crosby. He was also a true international recording artist: born in Mozambique to Greek and Lebanese parents, he was raised in Johannesburg, but gained his musical experience singing for a dance band led by Jimmy Liquime in India and Singapore during the mid-'20s.
